blog.title: Red Scharlach Points At Interesting Things
blog.description: Hello, I'm an English female grown-up and an enthusiastic purveyor of various forms of internet whimsy. This is a place to show you stuff I've drawn or written or otherwise cobbled together, as well as stuff I simply like the look of. You can also find me on Twitter, Instagram or Livejournal, or buy things in my Redbubble shop.

blog.name: keepsakeboxfilmstills
blog.title: Keepsake boxes
blog.description: I feel as though all great films and television programmes have a scene with some kind of keepsake or trinket box that the characters rummage through or keep something special in. Here are some examples of scenes in which this happens. Some images are my screenshots and others are re-blogged. Please let me know if you have any suggestions!

summary: Killing Eve S1 E7 This episode of Killing Eve has really pulled out all the stops in showcasing a classic curation of keepsakes....
caption:
Killing Eve S1 E7

This episode of Killing Eve has really pulled out all the stops in showcasing a classic curation of keepsakes. The chosen shots perfectly capture the essence of what I love about these kinds of scenes; the intimacy, awe, a moment of reflection, the light touch of skin upon varying textures, an almost sensuous experience. I fully realise now that the people in these scenarios are always alone, the lighting dimmed. It is a tender experience, a ponderous and poignant one. We become the character fully absorbed in another’s most treasured possessions, an absent person’s inner life in bygone days. Even if the owner of the keepsakes is still alive we are forced to ponder their morality, and our own. The small details; carefully tied string and thoughtfully places stickers, licked stamps and meticulously calligraphed letters, these are all especially unsettling in context. On this occasion we are being shown with absolute tenderness, the inner-life and more wholesome past of a cold-blooded serial killer.

blog.name: bagofthumbs
blog.title: Awkward as a bag of thumbs
blog.description:
I create BBC Sherlock podfic. Endless hours of our boys falling in love.

Buy Me a Coffee? (it only goes to offset costs of places to upload the podfic to)

Current WIP podfic status

The Grating Roar (by Engazed). Chapter 8 posted 6/23/19, new chapters will post each weekend.

Let Us Beware (by Prettyvk - WIP). Collection of short ficlets, companion pieces to The James Holmes Chronicles. I shall post updates as the author releases them.

And Your Very Flesh Shall Be A Great Poem (by CaitlinFairchild - WIP). The story has been dropped by the author unfinished, so I won't be able to finish the podfic. Sorry.

summary:
This is chapter 1 of a podfic for “Professional Boundaries”,
a story in the Killing Eve fandom, written by yotoob, set after the...
caption:
This is chapter 1 of a podfic for “Professional Boundaries”, a story in the Killing Eve fandom, written by yotoob, set after the events of Season 1.

First off, to my usual listeners, I have not abandoned the Sherlock fandom – I’m just waiting for permission to record the story I want to record next there.

In the meantime, to amuse myself, and after seeing so many recommendations for “Killing Eve”, I binged watched that.  There are eight episodes in Season 1 (the only season out at the time of writing this), and I thoroughly enjoyed it.  Then I went to AO3 to see if there was fan fiction for it yet.  And, of course, there was!  159, at the time I checked.  I sorted on kudos, and decided to read the highest rated story, where, if you know me, if I like the story, my brain immediately tells me that I need to record it.  I loved the authenticity of the voices, the humor, the short, snappy chapters, and the story arc worked for me.  So I promptly sent off a request to yotoob, the author, who graciously agreed to let me create a podfic for it.

Now, anybody who has listened to me before, knows I suck at accents.  So, many apologies.  On the upside, one of the main characters is American, so hey, that’s easy.  The other, is harder.  It’s largely a Russian accent, but the character herself knows multiple languages and can do different accents.  I’m trying, and I will continue to try and get better as I progress recording this story, but I understand that it will likely make some people cringe.  Please be kind.

https://archiveofourown.org/works/16459637

blog.name: plockd
blog.title: memory palace
blog.description: viagiordano on AO3 / D / 27 / Leo / Copenhagen / Generally a very intense, loud and giving person. I like vodka, women and house. Too busy for bad vibes.

summary: What are some things that you want to see for season 2 ?
question: What are some things that you want to see for season 2 ?
answer:
Hello, I love this question. Okay, here goes: 

1) Flashbacks. And I don’t mean these long, boring, bold & the beautiful dramatic flashbacks, but I mean like 1-3 frame glitches, sparks, of the following things: Eve and Villanelle flashbacking to the stabbing, Eve flashbacking to that moment when she attacked Niko at the Bridge Club (because, come on, he should not forgive her for that even though I think he probably will), but most of all: they made Anna be this huge force in Villanelle’s life. Six years later, the therapist still asks Villanelle if she dreams about Anna. Anna has to have been a very big deal, and the way she died so abruptly felt incredibly rushed. I hope we get some insight into why Anna was such an important factor for Villanelle. In the books, she flashbacks to her on and off, so I would want that in the show as well. 

2) I want to know if there is more to Konstantin’s “He was off limits” line about Bill. 

3) I want to see Villanelle pissed off about the knife-thing. Like, insanely, child-in-supermarket-level temper tantrum pissed off. 

4) I want to see what the freaking note Nadia wrote said because I have a feeling that it sure as hell does not say “Konstantin”. I have a feeling that thing is going to say “Martens”. I’m not going to go too deeply into this because most of it is connected to the second book, but boy oh boy, that woman is not clean. 

5) I have this mental image where season 2 doesn’t pick off right where season 1 ended, but a little bit in the future. In this image, Eve is in a hotel room, surrounded by all the stuff she’s gathered together about Villanelle and where she might be. And while she’s going through this stuff, we see Villanelle in a club somewhere, trying to have “fun”, but it’s so obvious that she’s thinking about the stabbing. So the frames skipping on and off between Eve and V would be awesome, but ugh, I know I’m not going to get this. (Phoebe come back I NEED YOU) 

6) Natalie. I want the story behind the name “Natalie.” So far, Villanelle has been Natalie in Bletcham, Natalia Popova in Russia, and when Eve asks who offed Nadia, Konstantin went “a little angry girl called Natalie”. What the fuck is that about? What’s up with the name Natalie?? 

7) I want Villanelle in action. Gore-y, chilling action. The kind of action that makes the viewers remember that she’s a cold-blooded killer. But I don’t want to see Eve in that scene, if you get my drift… 

8) Eve & Villanelle. These two idiots better get some proper screen-time together, and I’ll be fucking damned if Eve doesn’t come up to Villanelle and ask to see the scar. I. Will. Be. Damned. Also, I want these two to get the ending Luke Jennings made for them. That’s all I can come up with, for now :)

Hello, I love this question. Okay, here goes: 

1) Flashbacks. And I don’t mean these long, boring, bold & the beautiful dramatic flashbacks, but I mean like 1-3 frame glitches, sparks, of the following things: Eve and Villanelle flashbacking to the stabbing, Eve flashbacking to that moment when she attacked Niko at the Bridge Club (because, come on, he should not forgive her for that even though I think he probably will), but most of all: they made Anna be this huge force in Villanelle’s life. Six years later, the therapist still asks Villanelle if she dreams about Anna. Anna has to have been a very big deal, and the way she died so abruptly felt incredibly rushed. I hope we get some insight into why Anna was such an important factor for Villanelle. In the books, she flashbacks to her on and off, so I would want that in the show as well. 

2) I want to know if there is more to Konstantin’s “He was off limits” line about Bill. 

3) I want to see Villanelle pissed off about the knife-thing. Like, insanely, child-in-supermarket-level temper tantrum pissed off. 

4) I want to see what the freaking note Nadia wrote said because I have a feeling that it sure as hell does not say “Konstantin”. I have a feeling that thing is going to say “Martens”. I’m not going to go too deeply into this because most of it is connected to the second book, but boy oh boy, that woman is not clean. 

5) I have this mental image where season 2 doesn’t pick off right where season 1 ended, but a little bit in the future. In this image, Eve is in a hotel room, surrounded by all the stuff she’s gathered together about Villanelle and where she might be. And while she’s going through this stuff, we see Villanelle in a club somewhere, trying to have “fun”, but it’s so obvious that she’s thinking about the stabbing. So the frames skipping on and off between Eve and V would be awesome, but ugh, I know I’m not going to get this. (Phoebe come back I NEED YOU) 

6) Natalie. I want the story behind the name “Natalie.” So far, Villanelle has been Natalie in Bletcham, Natalia Popova in Russia, and when Eve asks who offed Nadia, Konstantin went “a little angry girl called Natalie”. What the fuck is that about? What’s up with the name Natalie?? 

7) I want Villanelle in action. Gore-y, chilling action. The kind of action that makes the viewers remember that she’s a cold-blooded killer. But I don’t want to see Eve in that scene, if you get my drift… 

8) Eve & Villanelle. These two idiots better get some proper screen-time together, and I’ll be fucking damned if Eve doesn’t come up to Villanelle and ask to see the scar. I. Will. Be. Damned. Also, I want these two to get the ending Luke Jennings made for them. That’s all I can come up with, for now :)

Our tumblr will only highlight certain updates. Visit our website daily for a full listing of new content. We hope you do enjoy all your visits.

blog.name: garland-on-thy-brow
blog.title: the brooding drummer who steals fans' hearts
blog.description:
Gene | lesbian | 23 | they/them, she/her, occasionally he/him.

Main topic: Late Roman Republic and its interpretations in fiction. Won't shut up about the portrait of Sempronia. Won't shut up about Bridge Theatre Julius Caesar.

Anthony J. Crowley wrote Shakespeare's Julius Caesar. Veva Blanc is alchemical. Symbrock is Brutecass. Killing Eve is EVErything. Rachel Weisz should play Philippa Eilhart.

[AO3]. Tags, about.

blog.title: Feminism in India
blog.description: Feminism in India is a social movement to learn, educate and develop a feminist consciousness among the youth. It is required to unravel the F-word and demystify all the negativity surrounding it.

summary: Killing Eve Review: Subverting The Spy Thriller Genre
title: Killing Eve Review: Subverting The Spy Thriller Genre
body:
Killing Eve Review: Subverting The Spy Thriller Genre

BBC America’s new thriller, Killing Eve, is the story of an MI5 investigator and an assassin who are both on a mission to find and kill the other but end up becoming mutually obsessed. Set primarily in present-day London, it is fundamentally a cat-and-mouse spy story but manages to be so much more.

The assassin, who has adopted the nom de gurreVillanelle, is played by the lovely Jodie Comer. She…
